meanings.definition: To reduce something to its essential elements.
meanings.sent1: She essentialized the story to just the main characters and plot.
meanings.sent2: The chef essentialized the recipe by using only three key ingredients.
meanings.sent3: He essentialized his wardrobe to just black and white clothes, which made him look like a walking zebra!
meanings.sent4: The artist essentialized the landscape, capturing only the most crucial details in his painting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher essentialized the lesson, focusing on the key points for better understanding.

meanings.definition: To make something essential or necessary.
meanings.sent1: Water is essentialized for our survival.
meanings.sent2: Education is essentialized for a better future.
meanings.sent3: His morning coffee is essentialized for a productive day ahead.
meanings.sent4: Love is essentialized for a happy life.
meanings.sent5: Sleep is essentialized for a healthy body and mind.

meanings.definition: To simplify or distill something to its core components.
meanings.sent1: The designer essentialized the logo to just a single letter.
meanings.sent2: The author essentialized the complex theory into a short, easy-to-understand article.
meanings.sent3: She essentialized her skincare routine to just two steps, which surprisingly worked wonders!
meanings.sent4: The scientist essentialized the data, highlighting only the most significant findings.
meanings.sent5: The musician essentialized the melody, stripping away all unnecessary notes for a cleaner sound.
